intro: Lithospermum rochelii, commonly known as scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Lithospermum rochelii is known for its rapid growth and short blooming period, usually occurring in late spring.
